document.docAuthor: Moore, Michael D., Beaver, Ethan P., Velasco-Castrillón, Alejandro & Stevens, Mark I.
document.masterDocTitle: Four new tri-forked species of the Australian genus Abantiades Herrich-Schäffer (Lepidoptera: Hepialidae) from the “ dark obscura clade ”

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Four new tri-forked species of the Australian genus Abantiades Herrich-Schäffer (Lepidoptera: Hepialidae) from the “ dark obscura clade ”

subSubSection.paragraph:
Simonsen (2018) produced a new diagnosis for the genus: “A patch of elongate scales at the forewing base and the ‘sensory tubercles’ on S2 are both unique and diagnostic for
Abantiades
.” He also noted that they have hepialine venation ( Dumbleton 1966 , Dugdale 1994), and mono-pectinate antennae that lack scales on the flagellum.
